primaryIsa.name: Primary Architecture
primaryIsa.description: "Primary Architecture" is the target architecture we support at the highest level, featuring timely updateds, complete features, receiving most attention from maintainers, and ample test devices.

secondaryIsa.name: Secondary Architecture
secondaryIsa.description: "Secondary Architecture" offers relatively complete functionality, but due to the limited number of devices, generally poorer performance, or insufficient attention from maintainers, while security updates are promptly addressed, other types of updates, testing, and feedback responses may be slightly less responsive than primary architecture.

aoscOsIsaInfoPrimary: For x86-64 (AMD64 or Intel 64) compatible devices
For 64-bit LoongArch devices with support for 128-bit vector instructions (LSX)
aoscOsIsaInfoSecondary: For little endian, 64-bit Power ISA v2.07 (and above) devices
afterglowIsaInfoPrimary: For MIPS-based Loongson 2F devices with LoongMMI support
For big endian, 32-bit PowerPC devices (IBM CHRP/PReP or Apple Macintosh and compatible platforms)
afterglowIsaInfoSecondary: For Arm (ARMv6 and Thumb-2, NEON) compatible devices
For Arm (ARMv7 and Thumb-2, NEON) compatible devices
For DEC Alpha (previously Alpha AXP) based devices
For Mortorola 68020 compatible devices with memory management unit (MMU)
For big endian, 64-bit PowerPC devices (IBM CHRP/PReP or Apple Macintosh and compatible platforms)
For 64-bit SPARC (SPARC V9 and VIS 1.0) compatible devices

omaSystemSupportInfo: Run this command in the terminal to install oma on Debian, Ubuntu, Linux Mint and its derivatives, as well as deepin,
Run this command in Termux (>= 0.118.2) to install oma
